name: A1RL0CK
description:
Your hands. They hit the reinforced metal. They're starting to hurt. There's nothing to do. 
The safety lock is engaged.

-----

A1RL0CK is a survival text adventure about a child and some voices. Also, a lot of proteins. If you are looking for the kind of game that goes: "This is what happened and this is what you must do", A1RL0CK is probably not for you as it has an in media res approach and may result obscure to many players until quite far in the playthrough. It's a story meant to unfold step by step and, although obviously not perfect (it was made in the time constraints of a Jam), it is intended to work like this.

PLAY IT ONLINE: HERE

-----

*** CONTENT WARNING *** 

May contain scenes not suitable for all audiences, like physical violence and psychological torment. 
No children were harmed in the making of this game. 

-----

Written by Marco Innocenti - Tested by Andrew Schultz and Gianluca Girelli.
PunyInform libraries by Johan Berntsson and Fredrik Ramsberg. Inform6 By Graham Nelson and a lot of other people. Converted for the C64 with Ozmoo by Johan Berntsson and Fredrik Ramsberg.

Other IF by the author can be found at AndromedaLegacy.com.
